{{Marvel Database:Organization Template
| Image                   = All-New Wolverine Vol 1 27 Textless.jpg
| Name                    = Orphans of X
| EditorialNames          = 
| Aliases                 = 

| Leaders                 = Amber, [[Henry Sutter (Earth-616)|Henry Sutter]]
| CurrentMembers          = Amber, Fatima, Haruto, Ian, Jasmine, Kenneth, Lisa, Maria, [[Henry Sutter (Earth-616)|Henry Sutter]]
| FormerMembers           = [[Sarah Kinney (Clone) (Earth-616)|"Sarah Kinney"]], unidentified rogue [[Hand (Earth-616)|Hand]] lieutenant

| Identity                = Secret
| Affiliation             =
| Allies                  = 
| Enemies                 = [[Akihiro (Earth-616)|Daken]], [[Yuriko Oyama (Earth-616)|Lady Deathstrike]], [[James Howlett (Earth-21923)|Logan]], [[Victor Creed (Earth-616)|Sabretooth]], [[Laura Kinney (Earth-616)|Wolverine]]

| Origin                  = [[Homo sapiens|Humans]] who've been orphaned by [[Homo superior|Mutants]] related to [[James Howlett (Earth-616)|Logan]]
| Reality                 = Earth-616
| Status                  = Active
| BaseOfOperations        = [[Brooklyn]], [[New York]]
| PlaceOfFormation        = 
| PlaceOfDissolution      = 

| Creators                = Tom Taylor; Leonard Kirk
| First                   = All-New Wolverine Vol 1 22

| History                 = The Orphans of X are an organization of individuals who have lost loved ones or been directly victimized by [[James Howlett (Earth-616)|Logan]], [[Yuriko Oyama (Earth-616)|Lady Deathstrike]], [[Laura Kinney (Earth-616)|Wolverine]], [[Victor Creed (Earth-616)|Sabretooth]], and others with similar powers. Having resolved to rid the world of all mutants like them.{{r|All-New Wolverine Vol 1 28|29}}

They were originally a support group for people who were negatively affected by those same individuals and the various organizations who enabled their killing sprees. Initially gathering to talk and share stories of their tragedies. After [[Immune|the events]] on [[Roosevelt Island]], seeing Laura Kinney honored as a hero infuriated [[Henry Sutter (Earth-616)|Henry Sutter]], to the point that he radicalized their gathering into a covert funded operation resigned to wipe them out entirely, militarizing the group and its associated connections in the process.{{r|All-New Wolverine Vol 1 30}}
| Equipment               = Because the Orphans of X have members throughout the world, ranging from regular citizens, to a rogue lieutenant within the [[Hand (Earth-616)|Hand]],{{r|All-New Wolverine Vol 1 29}} and even governmental or military personnel,{{Citation}} they are well-equipped with or have access to a wide array of weaponry, vehicles, and other equipment.
| Transportation          = Various ground vehicles, military aircraft, and helicopters provided by members.
| Weaponry                = Various small and heavy arms, [[Muramasa Bullets]]{{r|All-New Wolverine Vol 1 28}}
| Notes                   = * The Orphans were targeting those with power sets similar to [[James Howlett (Earth-616)|Logan]], citing them as too dangerous to be allowed to live; however, [[Yuriko Oyama (Earth-616)|Lady Deathstrike]] is actually a [[Cyborgs|Cyborg]] and not a [[Homo superior|mutant]], though she does possess [[Adamantium]] enhancements, as well as a [[Healing Factor]].{{r|All-New Wolverine Vol 1 28}} <!-- Not sure this is actually worth noting. -->
| Trivia                  = * Although their motives are similar to the [[Red Right Hand (Earth-616)|Red Right Hand]], creator [[Tom Taylor]] notes the resemblance was entirely coincidental.{{Citation}}
}}
